name: sgRNAScorer 2.0
description: This is a linear SVC model, which was trained on two datasets SpCas9 and St1Cas9. The feature space of the tool is comprised of the 80 binary positional features.

name: SSC - Spacer Scan for CRISPR
description: This is a linear classifier which used Elastic-Net for feature selection and was trained on the Xu dataset. The feature space of the tool is comprised of the 80 binary positional features.

name: CHOP CHOP (XU 2015 scoring)
description: The model is based on a penalized regression model, trained on the Xu dataset. The feature set includes the gc content, some position specific nucleotides and di-nucleotides in the sequence, PAM and tail sections.

name: CHOP CHOP (DOENCH 2014 scoring)
description: The model is based on an SVM with logistic regression which was trained on the Doench dataset.  The feature set includes the gc content, some position specific nucleotides and di-nucleotides in the sequence, PAM and tail sections.

name: CHOP CHOP (MORENO MATEOS scoring)
description: The model is a linear regression model trained on the Doench and Kuscu datasets. The feature set includes the gc content, some position specific nucleotides and di-nucleotides in the sequence, PAM and tail sections.

name: TUSCAN (Classification)
description: The model is a Random Forest Classifier, trained on a dataset of 28,606 target sites from combined sources. The feature set includes the GC content, counts of nucleotides and dinucleotides as well as position specific nucleotides and dinucleotides.

name: TUSCAN (Regression)
description: The model is a Random Forest Regressor, trained on a dataset of 28,606 target sites from combined sources. The feature set includes the GC content, counts of nucleotides and dinucleotides as well as position specific nucleotides and dinucleotides.

name: WU-CRISPR
description: The model is stacking model with two layers. The first layer uses 5 SVMs and 5 XGBoost models to predict the probabilities of a guide being efficient. The second layer uses the average result of the 5 SVM and the average result of the 5 XGBoost to predict the final probability, using a logistic model.
